column7: The panelists have thrown many great parties over the years - join them for conversations on how to be a good host, creating atmosphere, and maintaining energy. Bring your own best tips and great party stories.  Speakers include:Sal Sanfratello

Flame wars got you down? This panel will cover hacks for improving interpersonal communication.  Topics include: active listening, nonviolent communication, conflict resolution, consensus decision-making, validation, and common pitfalls and fallacies.  Speakers include:Ed Platt

Explore the pros and cons of writing for examiner.com and Yahoo’s associated content.  The discussion will compare writing content for the web versus print magazines.  Other topics to be covered include how to build your writing portfolio and setting deadlines for yourself.  Speakers include:Tracy Herrell, Rob Reed

column1: Plotters vs Pantsers – Finding the Storytelling That Works For You
column7: Some writers are plotters, and can’t proceed until they know how everything ends.  Some writers are pantsers, and they surprise themselves as they go.  How can you figure out which one you are, and how can you harness the strengths of each approach while avoiding the weaknesses?   Speakers include:Ferrett Steinmetz, Michael Cieslak, Jim Leach
Arduino is the original open hardware controller. Come discuss how you can use it and share your enthusiasm  Speakers include:

column1: Parasitic Paranormals: Getting Rid of Them
column7: How to remove unwanted things/beings from life, home and being. Discussion of different practices, spells, and ingredients that help to remove annoyances. After ghost hunting and magically cleansing many homes, I have found different things that work to remove attachments and parasitic paranormals.  Speakers include:Shetan Noir
Open forum for Q&A about filmmaking. Learn how to get started in filmmaking.  Speakers include:Keith Martens, James Fernandez

column1: Digging Up The Same Old Ground
column7: Are there any new stories left, or is everything just a retread of an old idea?  What is a retread, and what is a legitimately new angle?  Speakers include:Sean M. Davis, Ferrett Steinmetz, NIcole Castle
Learn how arcane objects like dekatrons, vacuum tubes, and nixies can make fun toys!  Speakers include:Keith Moore

Dedicated reviewing websites, personal blogs, Amazon, Goodreads... there are endless places online to get recommendations on what to read and what to watch - where is best, for what?  The panelists will discuss the ins and outs of reviewing material on-line.  Speakers include:Janea Schimmel

column1: What About The Happily Ever After?
column7: There was an insane Internet reaction to the Red Wedding from those who were watching Game of Thrones but hadn’t read it (to the reader's delight).  Is this indicative of an expectation among television and movie audiences that established characters survive?  Has Hollywood created the expectation of a happy ending, even in the harshest of fictional environments?  Is it more acceptable to kill off a character in print?  How do these expectations differ amongst genre fiction?  Speakers include: Jim Leach, Ferrett Steinmetz

column1: Line?  What Line?  Taboos and Speculative Fiction
column7: Incest, rape, children as warriors, the wholesale slaughter of children... there are many distasteful acts which are performed in speculative fiction.  Is there anything which is still off limits, or can anything be used as a plot device so long as it is germane to the story?  Speakers include:Ken MacGreggor, Sean M. Davis, Ferrett Steinmetz, Nicole Castle

column1: Of Gods, Heroes and Their Foes...
column7: Did you think 'Thor: The Dark World' was awful?  What would you like to see happen in 'X-Men: Days of Future Past'?  What would you have done differently regarding 'Captain America: Winter Solider'?  If these are questions you think about, then please join us for a rousing discussion of the movies and comics alike!   Interested in learning more about Marvel (and yes, DC) comics?  That's why we're here!  Note: there will be free comics and goodies giveaways!         Speakers include:Lucy Kitchen, Professor X

column1: The Importance of Editing and Non-Writing For Would-Be Writers
column7:
Editing is an important part of creating a book, even if it isn't as sexy as, you know, actually writing.  We'll be discussing editing, query letters, and all of the business crap that comes along with doing this for a living.  Speakers include:
Mary Lynne Gibbs, Michael Cieslak
Join us and read from your book or a favorite book!  Please sign up at Ops.  Speakers include:
Meet fellow gamers and find new adventures.   Speakers include:
Tony, Mat, and Mary record an episode of their popular Linux podcast, the Sunday Morning Linux Review  Speakers include:Mat Enders, Mary Tomich, Tony Bemus
Learn the not-quite-as-mysterious history of tarot and the basic concepts behind the cards and readings. Bring any questions you might have about tarot!  Speakers include:CJ Tremlett, Alex Page
Meet local designer Kevin Siembieda and tap his mind for ways to design your own games.  Speakers include:Kevin Siembieda

column1: You Monster! A Special Effects Makeup Demonstration
column7: Learn how to transform yourself and others into a hideous creatures that will impress your friends and terrify your enemies.  Speakers include:Kat McConnell
Movie making has become cheaper and easier. There are a number of fairly good quality amateur free movies/videos out there.  Which ones have you seen?  What did you like?  Speakers include:
